page.title: 04General Description 4
page.content: The railway,part of the L.N.E.R.,was completed very soon after the colliery began to produce coal.Horden had its own railway station but this was one of the many to fall under the axe in the Beeching Plan.The bulk of the coal produced is still moved by rail and the line is still part of the main Newcastle-Middlesbrough line but Hartlepool is the nearest railway station for passengers. After the Second World War the coal mines were nationalised and the coastal collieries of East Durham were to be expanded and modernised.A new town of Peterlee was planned and the very first part of it to be built was the Dene Villas area.This area is the extreme south west part of this block.Only a small area was used for this part of Peterlee, the main development being in the adjacent
